cards.title: Intro
cards.body: This windows command Cheat Sheet is a non exhaustive list of main windows command that you can use.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Clears the content of the screen.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays messages or enables/disables command echoing.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Provides help information for Windows commands.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Exits the CMD.EXE program (command interpreter).

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays or sets the date.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays or sets the system time.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays the Windows version.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays a list of files and subdir in a directory.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays the name of or changes the current directory.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Copies one or more files to another location.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Moves files and renames files and directories.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Deletes one or more files.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Creates a directory.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Removes a directory.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays the contents of a text file.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Renames a file or files.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Starts a separate window to run a specified program or cmd.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Allows you to shut down or restart the computer.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Displays all currently running tasks including services.

cards.title: Basic
cards.back: Ends one or more tasks or processes.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Displays or changes file attributes.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Compares two files and displays the differences between them.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Searches for a text string in a file or files.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Searches for strings in files.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Copies files and directory trees.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Robust File Copy for Windows, a more advanced version of `xcopy`.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Displays or alters the compression of files on NTFS partitions.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Expands one or more compressed files.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Replaces files.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Graphically displays the folder structure of a drive or path.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Sorts input.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Displays output one screen at a time.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Prints a text file.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Displays or alters the encryption of dir [files] on NTFS parts.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Compares the contents of two floppy disks.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Copies the contents of one floppy disk to another.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Formats a disk for use with Windows.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Checks a disk and displays a status report.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Creates, changes, or deletes the volume label of a disk.

cards.title: File
cards.back: Recovers readable information from a bad or defective disk.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Displays detailed configuration information about a computer and its operating system.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Displays current device driver status and properties.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Starts the System Information tool.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Registry Console Tool, used to manage the Windows Registry.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Displays or configures services (background processes).

cards.title: System
cards.back: Starts the Task Manager.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Windows Management Instrumentation , used for managing Windows systems.

cards.title: System
cards.back: System File Checker, scans and verifies the versions of all protected system files.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Refreshes local and Active Directory-based Group Policy settings.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Displays Group Policy settings and Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) for a user or computer.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Configures power settings.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Starts the DirectX Diagnostic Tool.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Starts the Microsoft System Information tool.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Starts the Performance Monitor.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Resultant Set of Policy, used to view Group Policy settings.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Starts the File Signature Verification tool.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Starts the System Configuration Editor.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Secures the Windows XP account database.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Displays or changes Com port mappings.

cards.title: System
cards.back: Changes the installed user mode.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays all current TCP/IP network configuration values.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Tests network connectivity to a specified host.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Traces the route taken by packets to a specified destination.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays active TCP connections, ports on which the computer is listening.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays information that you can use to diagnose Domain Name System (DNS) infrastructure.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Manages network resources, services, and user accounts.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Network Shell, used to configure and monitor network devices.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays and modifies the IP-to-Physical address translation tables used by the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP).

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays and modifies the entries in the local IP routing table.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Starts the File Transfer Protocol (FTP) client.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Starts the Telnet client.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays protocol statistics and current TCP/IP connections using NBT (NetBIOS over TCP/IP).

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays information about network connections.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Manages server computer connections.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Starts a network service.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Stops a network service.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays a list of resources being shared on a specified computer.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Manages user accounts.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Manages local groups.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Manages shared resources.

cards.title: Network
cards.back: Displays network statistics.

cards.title: Process Management
cards.back: Manages processes using Windows Management Instrumentation .

cards.title: Process Management
cards.back: Waits for specified number of seconds / until a key pressed.

cards.title: Disk Management
cards.back: Manages disk partitions.

cards.title: Disk Management
cards.back: Defragments a disk.

cards.title: Disk Management
cards.back: Converts a FAT volume to NTFS.

cards.title: Disk Management
cards.back: Manages disk performance counters.

cards.title: System Configuration
cards.back: Manages the Boot Configuration Data (BCD) store.

cards.title: System Configuration
cards.back: Configures, queries, or changes Boot.ini file settings.

cards.title: System Configuration
cards.back: Starts the System Configuration utility.

cards.title: System Configuration
cards.back: Starts the Registry Editor.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Get your Windows Product key

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Opens the command prompt and executes a specified command, keeping the window open.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Opens the command prompt, executes a specified command, and then closes the window.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Allows you to run multiple commands in sequence. For example, `command1 && command2`.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: \ | ` | Allows you to run a second command only if the first command fails. For example, `command1 `\ | \ | `  command2`.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Redirects the output of a command to a file, overwriting the file if it already exists. For example, `command > output.txt`.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Redirects the output of a command to a file, appending the output if the file already exists. For example, `command >> output.txt`.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: ` | Pipes the output of one command to another command. For example, `command1 `\ | ` command2`.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Redirects the output of a command to the Windows clipboard. For example, `dir `\ | `  clip`.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Loops through all `.txt` files in the current directory and echoes their names.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: `pushd` saves the current directory and then changes to a new directory. `popd` returns to the saved directory.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Displays, sets, or removes environment variables. For example, `set PATH=C:\newpath`.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Starts a program without waiting for it to finish.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Forcefully kills a process by its image name.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Lists all installed software on the system.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Displays the size, free space, and caption of all logical disks.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: ` `findstr /B /C:"OS Name" /C:"OS Version"` | Displays the OS name and version.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Lists all scheduled tasks in detail.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Displays a list of all saved Wi-Fi profiles.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Displays the password for a specific Wi-Fi profile.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Displays or modifies file extension associations.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Displays or modifies file types used in file extension associations.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Lists all installed drivers with detailed information.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Generates a detailed energy report for the system.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Generates a battery life report for laptops.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Mirrors a directory from one location to another, including subdirectories and files.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Creates a symbolic link to a directory.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Creates a hard link to a file.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Creates a directory junction.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Runs a DiskPart script to automate disk partitioning tasks.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Aborts a system shutdown.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Checks a disk and fixes errors, also recovers readable information from bad sectors.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Scans and repairs protected system files.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Repairs the Windows image using DISM.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Repairs the boot environment by copying boot files from the Windows directory.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Repairs the Master Boot Record (MBR).

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Writes a new boot sector to the system partition.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Scans for installations compatible with Windows and displays the entries that are currently not in the Boot Configuration Data store.

cards.title: Miscellaneouss Tips & Tricks
cards.back: Scans for installations compatible with Windows and allows you to select the installations you want to add to the Boot Configuration Data store.
